highlights: Reduced cloud costs by 70% by migrating code from Firebase to MongoDB with a custom express.js api server which is now being used by over 100k unique site visitors each day.
Worked with Monkeytype's owner/lead developer as well as another interested developer.
Used Javascript, Mongodb, Node.js, Express.js, Linux, Git, Discord.js.

Work part-time with a team of 4 other developers to develop OpenOndeamand, open-source software used by dozens of supercomputer centers around the world to make high-performance computing more accessible.
Develop Ruby on Rails and Nodejs web apps for interacting with Linux machines
Use Ruby & Ruby on Rails, Linux, Github, Asana, MS Teams, Nodejs, Nginx, Slurm

projects.name: Congol
projects.description: A website that allows users to play Conway's Game of Life with 2 competing players accross the internet.

projects.name: mathgenerator
projects.description: Created and maintain an open-source python package that generates a wide variety of math problems. Package has 85 stars on Github and has around 1000 downloads per month.
A website where users can store, share, search, discuss, vote on, and manage their ideas. Deployed the site to a live linux server.
projects.name: Ideaspot
Ghlog
projects.description: A command line application to upload journal entries to a Github repository.

projects.name: BeautifulVHS
projects.description: A website that displays a moving, 3d rendering of old vhs covers.

projects.name: Londree
projects.description: Currently creating a mobile/web app to keep track of the availability of laundry machines inside college dorms using React Native.

projects.name: Todarith
projects.description: Created a website that hosted a database of user-submitted and machine-generated math problems. Planned to be used for generating math problems and solutions using machine-learning.

projects.name: Recolorbot
projects.description: A reddit bot that colors black and white images using a deep learning image coloring API. Host the converted images on a python web server.

projects.name: Worksheetgen
projects.description: A python package that creates a printable pdf of a math worksheet. Created with the intention of being used with mathgenerator to create random math worksheets.

A python program that takes in a video of a slideshow presentation and uses opencv to detect differences in slides. Creates a pdf containing each slide shown in the video. Also created a website that allows users to have a minimal web interface to the tool.
projects.name: Vid2slides
